abstract: Private equity firms may be feeling unfriendly vibes from Washington these days, but the Supreme Court just gave Wall Street’s investment banks a big hug. In a 7-1 ruling, the nation’s highest court ruled that banks including Credit Suisse, Citigroup and Morgan Stanley are immune from antitrust lawsuits that alleged they conspired to drive up prices of initial public offerings in the late 1990’s.
lead_paragraph: Private equity firms may be feeling unfriendly vibes from Washington these days, but the Supreme Court just gave Wall Street’s investment banks a big hug. In a 7-1 ruling, the nation’s highest court ruled that banks including Credit Suisse, Citigroup and Morgan Stanley are immune from antitrust lawsuits that alleged they conspired to drive up prices of initial public offerings in the late 1990’s.

headline.main: Court Shields Banks from I.P.O. Antitrust Suits
